movesets.name: Choice Scarf

items.name: Choice Scarf
items.description: Hold item which raises Speed by 50%, but locks holder into one move.

movesets.description:
Moves

This set aims to be an effective revenge killer while also maintaining the option of sweeping late-game. High Jump Kick is a great STAB move that can be abused with Scraggy's ability, Moxie, to quickly gain Attack boosts. Knock Off is another excellent option and can also be used to revenge kill. Drain Punch can be used to heal, although more often than not Scraggy should use the more powerful High Jump Kick. Drain Punch is a safer early-game Fighting-type STAB, however. Poison Jab is used in order to hit Spritzee and Snubbull.

Set Details

Scraggy's EVs are maximized for power and Speed to revenge kill more effectively. With a Choice Scarf attached, Scraggy outspeeds all Pokemon at 21 Speed or below. Moxie is the preferred ability, as it allows Scraggy to rack up Attack boosts quickly and efficiently, and if played right, can result in a sweep.

Usage Tips

This set aims to sweep late-game and to revenge kill. Most Ghost-types will not switch into Scraggy for fear of Knock Off, allowing for one or two High Jump Kicks early-game. However, once the Choice Scarf is revealed, it is best to use either Drain Punch or Knock Off, depending on the situation, to avoid the disasterous recoil from a High Jump Kick miss against a Ghost-type switch-in. This set is best used late-game to clean up with Moxie, but can also be used to revenge kill if need be. You can use Scraggy to weaken its own checks and counters with Knock Off, but the Dragon Dance set is far superior in that regard due to the bulk achieved by equipping an Eviolite.

Team Options

Pokemon that can easily wear down the opponent so Scraggy can abuse Moxie make the best teammates. As such, Pokemon such as Dwebble or Ferroseed are extremely beneficial, as none of Scraggy's counters enjoy switching in on a full layer of entry hazards. Pawniard is helpful as well, as it spreads Knock Offs and Pursuit traps Ghost-types that block Scraggy's High Jump Kicks.

movesets.name: Dragon Dance

items.name: Eviolite
items.description: Boosts Defense and Special Defense of holder by 50% if it is an NFE Pokemon.

movesets.description:
Moves

This set aims to sweep an opponent's team with the use of Dragon Dance. Knock Off is the main STAB attack, and it is best used early-game to weaken Scraggy's own checks and counters. Drain Punch is the Fighting-type STAB of choice and helps Scraggy stay healthy, making it much harder for Scraggy to be revenge killed by priority attacks. The last slot can go to a multitude of moves. High Jump Kick is preferred, as it is a much stronger Fighting-type STAB with a chance of OHKOing Eviolite Mienfoo after a boost. Poison Jab can 2HKO Spritzee after some prior damage and loss of its Eviolite to Knock Off. Zen Headbutt can be used if Croagunk is a problem, as it is a clean OHKO. Head Smash can be used if you care to run a more risky set, as it always OHKOes Vullaby after a boost and Stealth Rock damage. Head Smash also OHKOes Larvesta and Ponyta.

Set Details

The EVs maximize Speed and give Scraggy extra points in bulk, with the rest thrown into Attack to deal as much damage as possible. Jolly is the preferred nature, as after a boost, Jolly Scraggy outspeeds all 21 Speed Pokemon, an important benchmark. Eviolite is chosen to increase Scraggy's bulk and therefore enable it to set up multiple Dragon Dances. Shed Skin is the preferred ability because it limits worries about status, although Moxie or Intimidate can be used to great effect. Moxie allows for devastating late-game sweeping, while Intimidate allows Scraggy to set up more easily. A more offensive spread of 36 HP / 236 Atk / 212 Spe is usable if you prefer the boost in damage output. This spread has a higher chance of OHKOing Fletchling with an unboosted High Jump Kick, a high chance to OHKO Trubbish with Zen Headbutt at +1, and can deal more damage to Spritzee with Poison Jab at +1.

Usage Tips

Early-game, Scraggy should use Knock Off on its checks and counters as they switch in. Once everything on the opponent's team has been weakened, Scraggy can set up and sweep. Most of Scraggy's checks and counters cannot take boosted attacks without their item. Scraggy is great on almost any team thanks to its bulk and power, but offensive teams and balanced teams work best.

Team Options

Fletchling is a great partner, as Scraggy lures in numerous Fighting-types that Fletchling can immediately threaten, and Scraggy can use Knock Off against Pokemon that give Fletchling trouble, such as Chinchou. Pawniard forms a double-Dark core, so the two can weaken each other's checks and counters. Carvanha also forms a double-Dark core and provides wallbreaking power to weaken Scraggy's counters, such as Larvesta or Spritzee. Destiny Bond also helps to take down a big threat on the opponent's team. Frillish can spread burns to weaken the opponent's team and provide synergy by sponging Fighting-type attacks intended for Scraggy. Larvesta helps because Scraggy lures in Fighting-types for Larvesta to burn. Scraggy appreciates entry hazards from Dwebble or Ferroseed as they soften up the opponent's team, making it easier to sweep.

moves.name: Amnesia
moves.description: Boosts Special Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Brick Break
moves.description: Destroys Light Screen and Reflect, then hits.

moves.name: Bulk Up
moves.description: Boosts Attack and Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Chip Away
moves.description: Ignores the target's stat changes.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Counter
moves.description: If hit by a physical attack, returns double the damage.

moves.name: Crunch
moves.description: 20% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Dark Pulse
moves.description: 20% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Detect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Dig
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Dragon Claw
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Dragon Dance
moves.description: Boosts Attack and Speed by 1 stage.

moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.description: Leeches 50% damage.

moves.description: Hits 2 times in one turn.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Fake Out
moves.description: The user always moves first, and flinches the foe. Can only be used on the first turn out.

moves.name: Feint Attack
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Fire Punch
moves.description: 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Fling
moves.description: Throws the user's hold item at the foe. Power and effect depend on the item.

moves.name: Focus Blast
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Focus Punch
moves.description: Fails if the user takes damage before it hits.

moves.name: Foul Play
moves.description: Uses the target's Attack stat in damage calculation.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Grass Knot
moves.description: Deals damage based on the foe's weight.

moves.name: Head Smash
moves.description: Has 1/2 recoil.

moves.name: Headbutt
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch the target.

moves.name: Sludge Bomb
moves.description: 30% chance to poison.

moves.name: Smack Down
moves.description: Can hit if target is using Fly, Bounce, or Sky Drop. Ends target's airborne moves and its benefits from Flying type or Levitate.

moves.description: Lowers target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Snatch

moves.name: Snore

moves.name: Spite
moves.description: Lowers the PP of the move used last by 1-5.

moves.name: Stone Edge
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Strength
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Substitute

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.description: Summons sun for 5 turns.

moves.name: Super Fang
moves.description: Does damage equal to half the foe's current HP.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Taunt
moves.description: Forces the foe to use damaging moves for 2 turns.

moves.name: Thunder Punch
moves.description: 10% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Torment
moves.description: Prevents the target from using the same move twice in a row.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: Work Up
moves.description: Boosts user's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Zen Headbutt
moves.description: 20% chance to flinch.

abilities.name: Intimidate
abilities.description: Lowers the foe's Attack by 1 stage. Decreases wild encounter rate.

abilities.name: Moxie
abilities.description: Boosts Attack by 1 stage if the wielder knocks out another Pokemon.
